name: treatment of water discharge from petroleum/natural gas extraction, onshore | water discharge from petroleum/natural gas extraction, onshore | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/3092/documentation

This activity represents the emissions related to the discharge of water, in kg, produced during extraction of crude petroleum oil and natural gas in onshore operations.;According to Meili et al. (2023), the produced water may originate as natural water in the formations holding oil and gas or can be water that was previously injected into those formations through activities designed to increase oil production from the formations such as water flooding or steam flooding operations. In some situations, additional water from other formations adjacent to the hydrocarbon-bearing layers may become part of the produced water that comes to the surface.;The physical and chemical properties of produced water vary considerably depending on the geographic location of the field, the geologic formation from which the water was produced, and the type of hydrocarbon product being produced. Because data on oil emissions is available for different production areas, this value is not used directly at discharge of produced water but is assessed in the inventory of crude oil production directly (as described in section 10.3 of Meili et al. 2023).;The water balance for type of freshwater input and reinjection and discharge of (treated) produced water is modelled in the central production dataset at the country-level, to enable regionalized assessment of water impacts (see Meili et al. 2023, chapter 12).;Reference(s):;C. Meili, N. Jungbluth, M. Bussa (2023) Life cycle inventories of crude oil and natural gas extraction. ESU-services Ltd. Schaffhausen, Switzerland. Available from: http://esu-services.ch/data/public-lci-reports/

This activity starts after the (pre-)treatment of water produced in oil and gas extraction, at the point of discharge to the environment.

Emissions of water pollutants without water content discharged to rivers after treatment. Oil emissions are not included and are considered separately. Water in- and output have to be considered separately.
category: B:Mining and quarrying/06:Extraction of crude petroleum and natural gas/062:Extraction of natural gas/0620:Extraction of natural gas
tags: Sector: Waste Treatment & Recycling; Resource Extraction

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Time of publications. Most figures could be verified for 2011.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Data from offshore production are applied for global onshore production. Specific measurements for onshore production were not available. Following Meili et al. (2023), the same emission inventory is used for discharge onshore as for offshore, but the subcategory for the water emissions is changed to “to surface water” instead of “to ocean”. Uncertainties of this estimation are relatively high because different values are expected for different regions and there are only values for a random sample of the various regions.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Publication in environmental reports and other literature.

flow.name: water discharge from petroleum/natural gas extraction, onshore
flow.category: B:Mining and quarrying/06:Extraction of crude petroleum and natural gas/062:Extraction of natural gas/0620:Extraction of natural gas
